Description: Fragment of a wheel-made pottery lamp with a curved underbody and an inturned concave rim with incised letters. Bands of glaze, variously fired, inside and out. Fine pink fabric with very rare fine mica or quartz inclusions <0.1mm.
Curator's comments: Parallel from Athens (Howland 1958, Type 19, no. 143). Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals. Princeton
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q20)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 449)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.32) (Phase 1)
